page.title: 04 BEACHES by Tracey Duffield
page.content: BEACHES by Tracey Duffield There are five beaches in Brixham. They are:- Breakwater, St. Mary's Bay, Fishcombe, Mansands and Churston. St. Mary's is sandy and stony. It has one shop. There are three ways of getting down to this beach, the steps, the muddy cliff way by the shop and the cliff itself. Breakwater Beach has a shop. There are two ways of getting to this beach, by the slipway or by the steps. There is a raft at Breakwater, you can fish down there, you can jump or dive off the rocks. Fishcombe beach has a raft and every Wednesday there they hold a competition which is for everyone. Adults pay 10p to enter and children pay 5p..
